items.content_html:
Bumps prettier from 3.1.0 to 3.1.1.

Release notes

Sourced from prettier's releases.

3.1.1

ðŸ”— Changelog

Changelog

Sourced from prettier's changelog.

3.1.1

diff

Fix config file search (#15363 by @â€‹fisker)

Previously, we start search for config files from the filePath as a directory, if it happened to be a directory and contains config file, it will be used by mistake.

â”œâ”€ .prettierrc
â””â”€ test.js         (A directory)
  â””â”€ .prettierrc

// Prettier 3.1.0
await prettier.resolveConfigFile(new URL("./test.js", import.meta.url));
// <CWD>/test.js/.prettierrc
// Prettier 3.1.1
await prettier.resolveConfigFile(new URL("./test.js", import.meta.url));
// <CWD>/.prettierrc

Skip explicitly passed symbolic links with --no-error-on-unmatched-pattern (#15533 by @â€‹sanmai-NL)

Since Prettier v3, we stopped following symbolic links, however in some use cases, the symbolic link patterns can't be filtered out, and there is no way to prevent Prettier from throwing errors.

In Prettier 3.1.1, you can use --no-error-on-unmatched-pattern to simply skip symbolic links.

Consistently use tabs in ternaries when useTabs is true (#15662 by @â€‹auvred)

// Input
aaaaaaaaaaaaaaa
	? bbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbb
	: ccccccccccccccc
	  ? ddddddddddddddd
	  : eeeeeeeeeeeeeee
	    ? fffffffffffffff
	    : gggggggggggggggg;
// Prettier 3.1.0
aaaaaaaaaaaaaaa
? bbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbb
: ccccccccccccccc
? ddddddddddddddd
: eeeeeeeeeeeeeee
? fffffffffffffff
</tr></table>

... (truncated)

Commits
  • b86701d Release 3.1.1
  • c97480c Use attributes instead of deprecated assertions (#15758)
  • 0d1ffb3 Consistently use tabs in ternaries when useTabs is true (#15662)
  • 5f7aedc fix example to fit the actual experimentalTernaries behaviour (#15747)
  • 1e30f66 Remove claim, untrue since over 5 years ago, that cursorOffset is incompatibl...
  • 39e4e7b Add cursorOffset to Playground (#15751)
  • 8e816ad Allow skipping symlink patterns, to avoid raising a fault (#15533)
  • 2ca5d75 Fix expect call in dts test (#15766)
  • 15c7428 chore(deps): update dependency flow-parser to v0.223.3 (#15760)
  • d3b3d4f chore(deps): update dependency hermes-parser to v0.18.0 (#15761)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

Release notes

Sourced from @â€‹mdn/yari's releases.

v2.37.1

2.37.1 (2023-12-08)

Bug Fixes

  • auth-container: always show login/signup in row (#10125) (233bed6)
  • css: remove unused minmax function (#10138) (d8e84b5)
  • workflows: use Node.js version from .nvmrc file (#10153) (97405ae)

Miscellaneous

  • deps-dev: bump html-webpack-plugin from 5.5.3 to 5.5.4 (#10149) (abaa08d)

items.content_html:
Range syntax for media queries looks good at the moment, removing a note that support is unstable, and adding basic example to Learn article.

See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@media#browser_compatibility
items.title: docs(CSS): Range syntax support is maturing, adding example of range syntax to MQ Learn

items.title: docs: update is trusted

items.content_html:
Description

This corrects the imprecise statement regarding Chrome behavior as explained in #30921. In addition, it adds the information that Firefox shows a prompt both when the site requires authentication and when it does not.

Motivation

The previous information on Chrome was inaccurate. See #30921.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests

Addresses #30921, possibly resolves it. It may be nice to have another example (with reliable source) for another browser that is actually stricter than Firefox to make the initially intended point.
items.title: More precise URL credential deprecation explanation (addresses #30921)

items.content_html:
I can't find any documentation about using a built-in server, only configuring access to an already running server, and it appears this functionality is removed, so I think we should remove this para.

We're covering how to start a local server in multiple places, this should be consolidated, but I'd like to at a minimum remove broken docs in the meantime.

items.title: fix apiref of CookieStoreManager and some word fix

items.content_html:
Description

Remove the audio/wav mime type.

Motivation

Given that the title of this page says, "MIME types (IANA media types)", it should only include official IANA types.

... and despite numerous citations around the web from unauthoritative sites, audio/wav is not actually listed anywhere in the IANA MIME type registry: https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml

In fact, the only mentions of wav mime types on iana.org refer to the [experimental] audio/x-wav type.

(And, fwiw, the audio/wav type is not mentioned in Apache or NGINX's mime type files.)
items.title: Remove WAVE mime type

items.content_html:
• fixes #3397

The updates assert that the rendered image size doesn't change but the image quality does change on higher resolution displays.

  • Also, mdn/learning-area#694 updates the demo code. The changes tell viewers which image got loaded.
items.title: fix(html): update resolution switching demo pros

items.content_html:
Description

Based on these examples, I was having no luck getting nested media queries to work with min-width in Chrome. Then I looked up the the regular @media docs and they all showed examples using a colon. This works in Chrome:

		#foo {
			flex-direction: column;

			@media (max-width: 720px) {
				flex-direction: row;
			}
		}

Motivation

Showing examples that work.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Fix incorrect min-width examples in `nesting_at-rules/index.md`

items.content_html:
• fixes #12477

iframes have different behavior for onload and onerror events than other HTML elements. This is because of security reasons: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=365457#c6

Tested this on latest Chrome, Firefox, and Safari browsers. All have the same behavior.
items.title: fix(html): add onerror and onload event info on iframe page

Related issues and pull requests

items.title: Add documentation of component.utils exportFunction and cloneInto

items.content_html:
Description

Fixes #30463.

PWA really means: meeting a certain number of criteria in order to make the browser promote your site as a high-quality app.
Safari (and Edge) also support installing any site as a standalone app. That's great. But it's just not PWA as it's been designed years ago.

The PWA on MDN is about PWA in the strict sense of the term. So the goal isn't to change this. The goal of this PR is to mention sites as apps so that readers aren't confused when they read the guide while also having heard about the ability from Safari to install any site.

Motivation

The discussion in #30463.

Additional details

https://support.apple.com/en-ph/104996

https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/install-manage-or-uninstall-apps-in-microsoft-edge-0c156575-a94a-45e4-a54f-3a84846f6113

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Clarifying PWA promotability vs. installability and mentioning sites as apps

items.content_html:
Description

#27781 contains the engineering technical review for my work on Fenced Frames docs, which has been completed and approved. Thank you to @gtanzer and others for your thorough and detailed review work.

This is a new PR based on the same branch, which is intended to contain the editorial review for the same work.

Background information

Fenced frames are an integral part of Google's privacy sandbox technologies. Many parts of this set are being made available by default in Chrome 115 (depending on a gradual ramp up to 100% of userbase over the 115 release period).

See my research document for more details of exactly what changes are expected in the PR.

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: feat: Editorial review: Fenced Frames docs

items.content_html:
Description

HTTP docs on X-Frame-Options need a quick refresh.

  • Use warnings instead of info to direct users to CSP alternatives
  • How to use Helmet to set X-Frame-Options if you absolutely need to
  • Typo from unrelated PR for latest EPUB spec
  • Use supported languages in syntax highlighting
items.title: docs(HTTP): Refresh info on X-Frame-Options, frameguard, usage of Helmet in Express apps

items.content_html:
I've tried to apply the feedback from #29842 and reorganized some of the sections to hopefully make them clearer.

Description

This adds language around the specifics of how the pattern attribute's functionality compares with "normal" JS regular expression (notably the addition of the v flag). It also reorganizes the a11y and usability considerations so they read a bit better and aren't spread out across the document.

Motivation

Because I got confused about why [\w-] was not working inside a pattern attribute. It took asking several people before someone was able to point out that the v flag gets applied and that's why the behaviour was different.

Additional details

whatwg/html#7908

Related issues and pull requests

fixes #26907, relates to #29842.
items.title: Update HTML input pattern attribute documentation (fixes #26907)
